t: when*pn I would heal Israel, the*ld iniquity of Ephraim is revealed, and*ld the evil deeds of Samaria, for*ln they deal falsely; the*ld thief breaks in, and*ld the bandits raid outside.
But*ln they do not consider that*ld I remember all their evil. Now*ln their deeds surround them; they*ld are before my face.
By*ln their evil they make the king glad, and*ld the princes by their treachery.
They*ln are all adulterers; they*ld are like a heated oven whose*ln baker ceases to stir the fire, from*ld the kneading of the dough until*ld it is leavened.
On*ln the day of our king, the princes became*ld sick with the heat of wine; he*ld stretched out his hand with mockers.
For*ln with hearts like an oven they approach their intrigue; all*ld night their anger smolders; in*ld the morning it blazes like a flaming fire.
All*ln of them are hot as an oven, and*ld they devour their rulers. All*ln their kings have fallen, and*ld none of them calls upon me.
Ephraim*pn mixes himself with the peoples; Ephraim*ld is a cake not turned.
Strangers*ln devour his strength, and*ld he knows it not; gray*ln hairs are sprinkled upon him, and*ld he knows it not.
The*ln pride of Israel testifies to his face; yet*ld they do not return to the Lord*s their God, nor*ld seek him, for all this.
Ephraim*pn is like a dove, silly*ld and without sense, calling*ld to Egypt, going to Assyria.
As*ln they go, I will spread over them my net; I*ld will bring them down like birds of the heavens; I*ld will discipline them according to the report made to their congregation.
Woe*ln to them, for they have strayed from me! Destruction*ld to them, for they have rebelled against me! I*ln would redeem them, but*ld they speak lies against me.
They*pn do not cry to me from the heart, but*ld they wail upon their beds; for*ln grain and wine they gash themselves; they*ld rebel against me.
Although*ln I trained and strengthened their arms, yet*ld they devise evil against me.

They*ln return, but not upward; they*ld are like a treacherous bow; their*ln princes shall fall by the sword because*ld of the insolence of their tongue. This*ln shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
